page.title: 18Customs in Mayfield.
page.content: Although Mayfield is now a village of many commuters & other newcomers,the old customs have been continued & many revived.Amongst the various village organisations is the Women's Institute who start the year of activities with their pantomime in the Memorial Hall. The village Band takes part in competitions.Every Saturday there is a Jumble Sale.In May on Ascension Day St.Dunstan's Choir sing carols from the Church Tower at 7am.This is the beginning of the 'fete season' organised by different societies, including the village Primary School who also run an 'Its a Knockout' competition.In June we have the Carnival Dance when a local girl is chosen to be the 'Carnival Queen'. Another traditional date is the Summer Flower Show when villagers enter their various exhibits of flowers & produce.
